answers.answer: There are many causes of rapid weight loss but seldom this amount of weight in such a short period, unless fasting.  Some of the more common causes would be a loss of fluid due to use of diuretics and/or laxatives, an overactive thyroid gland, eating disorders such as anorexia or bulimia, chronic poisoning and probably the most common diabetes mellitus, commonly called sugar diabetes.  Weight loss can also be associated with some tumors but that is usually accompanied by a poor appetite.You should see your doctor as soon as you can and an exam and a few simple tests should quickly provide an answer.Good luck

Not sure you posted this in the correct forum, as it doesn't appear to be related to Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD), which is a serious systemic progressive lung condition including emphysema and chronic bronchitis.I'd suggest you start by making a prompt appointment with & seeing your family physician or internist and asking for a complete workup to see what's going on.  It may include some blood tests and other evaluation.One thing that occurs off-hand is whether you've ever been evaluated for Celiac disease, where the body is unable to tolerate gluten and wheat, which can cause weight loss and digestive issues.  Your docs can help you investigate to see what's going on with your body.Good luck!Starion
